org.apache.heron.common.testhelpers

Class HeronServerTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.heron.common.testhelpers.HeronServerTester

  • public class HeronServerTester
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to help simplify testing HeronServer implementations by consolidating common test functionality. A new instance of this class should be used for each test. After initializing the class, tests should call start() which guarantees the following:
    1. the server has started
    2. the client has been launched
    Upon test completion, the stop() method should be closed to properly release resources. This method is safe to be called on an instance that was never properly started.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HeronServerTester.AbstractTestClient
      Abstract class to simplify writing test clients by providing default method impls.
      static class  HeronServerTester.SuccessResponseHandler
      Generic SuccessResponseHandler that asserts that the response status code is OK and that the message is of the expected type.
      static interface  HeronServerTester.TestRequestHandler
      Interface to provide the Message to be sent upon onConnect and the expected Message.Builder to be used for the response.
      static interface  HeronServerTester.TestResponseHandler
      Interface to handle a response received by the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HeronServerTester

        public HeronServerTester(HeronServer server,
                         HeronServerTester.TestRequestHandler requestHandler,
                         HeronServerTester.TestResponseHandler responseHandler,
                         java.time.Duration responseReceivedTimeout)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor to use for the common use case of sending a single request and taking some action upon a response. The start() method does the following:
        1. Initializes the server and a default client
        2. Calls sendMessage on the client using the message from TestRequestHandler
        3. Waits up to responseReceivedTimeout for the client to receive a response
        4. Invokes the TestResponseHandler.handleResponse method
        Parameters:
        server - the server to test
        requestHandler - the request handler to use to build the request and response builder
        responseHandler - the handler to handle the received response
        responseReceivedTimeout - how long to wait for the response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • HeronServerTester

        public HeronServerTester(HeronServer server,
                         HeronClient client)
        Constructor where a custom client is to be used. The start() method starts both the server and the client.
        Parameters:
        server - server to test
        client - client to test

        public static void await(java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch latch)
        Convenience method to wait on a latch with a default timeout. If the timeout is reached, the fail() method will be invoked.

      • await

        public static void await(java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch latch,
                         java.time.Duration timeout)
        Convenience method to wait on a latch with a default timeout. If the timeout is reached, the fail() method will be invoked.
